text:
Message 72 of 287
The plan we signed says Winter Break starts after school on Friday until the Sunday.
Sent:12/10/2024 at 10:43 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/10/2024 at 10:43 AM)
Subject:Re: SAAS backcountry
On 12/10/2024 at 10:08 AM, Robert Moyer wrote:
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/10/2024 at 10:37 AM)
Subject:Re: SAAS backcountry
Attachments:Winter_Break_2024.jpg (141 KB)
I don't want to argue, either. And you went straight to the lawyers in this instead of even asking if we could work together. That mode won't
help us unless Natalie is on a permanent retainer, so you can always go after me. I am suggesting a path forward of compromise and solutions.
The SAAS calendar explicitly states that Winter Break starts on December 23, 2024, which suggests that December 21–22 is still part of the
regular schedule, not Winter Break. If the weekend should not be interrupted, then it has to start for it not to be interrupted.
Let's not be jerks to each other. Would you prefer to insist that Winter Break starts before Winter Break or work together?
On 12/10/2024 at 09:56 AM, Christine Moyer wrote:
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/10/2024 at 09:56 AM)
Subject:Re: SAAS backcountry
The holidays take priority over regular time.
So if one of us gets Spring break, winter break etc, it would not be interrupted if one of us has that weekend.
If you disagree, I can send my travel authorization via Natalie and Lisa can respond with your interpretation.
I would prefer not to argue here. That’s what Natalie and I very specifically discussed with Rosen that I would get that weekend as I have boys
over Winter Break.
On 12/10/2024 at 09:48 AM, Robert Moyer wrote:
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/10/2024 at 09:52 AM)
Subject:Re: SAAS backcountry
That was not communicated. I don’t understand how my weekend could be taken away?
On 12/10/2024 at 09:47 AM, Christine Moyer wrote:
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/10/2024 at 09:47 AM)
Subject:Re: SAAS backcountry
Yes but Dec 20-23 falls during the winter break.
In mediation I specifically asked Judge Rosen as I thought we had to negotiate these dates to take boys to Whistler. He confirmed I did not as it
fell during winter break which overrides the regular schedule. I asked him to communicate that to your side.
